description: Number of partitions of n into parts of 4 kinds.
comments: a(n) is Euler transform of A010709. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 17 2008
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..500
Index entries for expansions of Product_{k >= 1} (1-x^k)^m
Vaclav Kotesovec, A method of finding the asymptotics of q-series based on the convolution of generating functions, arXiv:1509.08708 [math.CO], Sep 30 2015, p. 8.
formula: G.f.: Product_{m>=1} 1/(1-x^m)^4.a(0)=1, a(n)=1/n*sum(k=0,n-1, 4*a(k)*sigma_1(n-k)). - _Joerg Arndt_, Feb 05 2011a(n) ~ exp(2 * Pi * sqrt(2*n/3)) / (2^(7/4) * 3^(5/4) * n^(7/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 28 2015
maple: with(numtheory): a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(d*4, d=divisors(j)) *a(n-j), j=1..n)/n) end: seq(a(n), n=0..40); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 17 2008
mathematica: nmax=50; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1-x^k)^4,{k,1,nmax}],{x,0,nmax}],x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 28 2015 *)CoefficientList[1/QPochhammer[x]^4 + O[x]^40, x] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 31 2016 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
